Description: Handle sherd of large Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (mostly worn); part of two added red bands; exterior: dotted squares around handle roots; handle streaky black (fired brown) on exterior, reserved on underside and on interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0099) (phase 2)
